NewsLines.HeadLine: SCHEDULE-World News at 1400 GMT

NewsLine.NewsLineText: WORLD NEWS SCHEDULE AT 1400 GMT:SCHEDULE-World News at 1400 GMT

body.p: Following are the main news stories due in the next few hours or moved earlier (all times GMT):
GERMAN ELECTION
BERLIN - Germany faces continued economic stagnation after Chancellor Gerhard Schroeder wins re-election with a reduced majority that narrows his scope to implement painful reforms.
(GERMANY (UPDATE 4), BY DAVID CROSSLAND, EXPECT BY 1500, PICTURE, GRAPHIC)
SEE ALSO:
GERMANY-RELATIONS, BY EMMA THOMASSON, MOVING SHORTLY
GERMANY-ELECTION-MINISTER (UPDATE 1), BY NICK TATTERSALL, MOVED
ECONOMY-GERMANY-ELECTION (WRAPUP 1) BY NICK ANTONOVICS, MOVING SHORTLY
GERMANY-SCHROEDER (NEWSMAKER), BY ERIK KIRSCHBAUM, EXPECT BY 1500
ISRAELI-PALESTINIAN CONFLICT
RAMALLAH - Israeli and Palestinian officials hold their first talks since army imposed siege of Yasser Arafat's West Bank headquarters, but fail to end four-day-old standoff.
(MIDEAST (UPDATE 4), BY WAFA AMR, EXPECT BY 1800, PICTURE, GRAPHIC)

UNITED NATIONS - U.N. Security Council holds emergency debate on Middle East crisis as Israeli forces keep Palestinian President Arafat penned up in sole building still standing in his shattered Ramallah headquarters compound.
(MIDEAST-UN, BY IRWIN ARIEFF, EXPECT BY 1700)
SEE ALSO:
MIDEAST-PROTESTS, BY NIDAL AL-MUGHRABI, MOVING SHORTLY, PICTURE
MIDEAST-BULLDOZER, BY CHRISTINE HAUSER, EXPECT BY 1800, PICTURE
MIDEAST-TURKEY (UPDATE 1), BY AYLA JEAN YACKLEY, MOVED Iraq.
MIDEAST-SYRIA-OMRAN (INTERVIEW), BY SAMIA NAKHOUL, MOVED
IVORY COAST TURMOIL

YAMOUSSOUKRO - French troops sent to help Westerners trapped by bloody military uprising set up camp on road to Ivory Coast's second city, where dozens of American children are among foreigners in hiding.
(IVORYCOAST (UPDATE 3), BY EMMANUEL BRAUN, EXPECT BY 1800)
EUROPE
MOSCOW - Rescuers evacuate residents of Caucasus valley from floodwaters rising dramatically after weekend Caucasus mudslide in which more than 100 people are missing and feared dead.
(RUSSIA-MUDSLIDE, BY OLIVER BULLOUGH, MOVED)
ROME - Italy appeals for European help to tackle a wave of illegal immigrants after another boating tragedy brings death to the country's shores.
(ITALY-IMMIGRATION, BY CRISPIAN BALMER, MOVING SHORTLY)
MADRID - Row between Spain and Morocco over a deserted Mediterranean islet flares anew after Rabat cancels talks at last minute, alleging Madrid landed a military helicopter on the disputed island
(SPAIN-MOROCCO (UPDATE 1), BY DANIEL FLYNN, MOVED)
INDIA
SRINAGAR, India, - Militants launch string of attacks on security forces and political workers in Indian Kashmir as violence flares on eve of second round of state assembly elections.
(KASHMIR (UPDATE 5), BY SANJEEV MIGLANI AND SHEIKH MUSHTAQ, MOVING SHORTLY, PICTURE)
SEE ALSO KASHMIR-SEPARATISTS (INTERVIEW), BY TERRY FRIEL, MOVED
AFGHANISTAN

KABUL - Afghanistan's Northern Alliance, backbone of the U.S.-backed government of Hamid Karzai, has issued a strongly worded criticism of the president and warned he was running risks if he did not change his policies.
(AFGHAN-ALLIANCE-WARNING, BY SAYED SALAHUDDIN, MOVED)

HERAT, Afghanistan - Senior U.S. Treasury official visits the strategic western Afghan city of Herat near the Iranian border as part of a trip aimed at urging donor countries to come up with cash they pledged to the war-torn state after the Taliban's fall.
(AFGHAN-USA-RECONSTRUCTION, BY MIKE COLLETT-WHITE, EXPECT BY 1430
SEE ALSO AFGHAN-ALQAEDA-HERAT, BY MIKE COLLETT-WHITE, MOVED
IRAN
TEHRAN - Iran says it accepts nomination of new British ambassador, ending seven-month diplomatic rift after Tehran's rejection of Britain's former candidate for the job earlier this year.
(IRAN-BRITAIN (UPDATE 2), BY PARISA HAFEZI, EXPECT BY 1630)
UNITED NATIONS
UNITED NATIONS - Acknowledging the U.N. is bogged down in endless meetings and too many reports, Secretary-General Annan unveils plan to make world body more efficient.
(UN-REFORM (UPDATE 1), BY IRWIN ARIEFF, EMBARGOED FOR RELEASE AT 1500)
AFRICA
GOMA, Congo - Rwanda's pull-out from Congo risks enflaming an already desperate humanitarian crisis as armed groups battle for control in the resulting power vacuum, aid workers say.
(CONGO-DEMOCRATIC-HUNGER, BY MATTHEW GREEN, EXPECT BY 1500, PICTURE)
ABUJA - Special Commonwealth talks on Zimbabwe open with prospects of tougher sanctions on the southern African nation increasing as President Robert Mugabe shunned the meeting in Abuja.
(ZIMBABWE-TALKS-MUGABE (UPDATE 1), BY JOHN CHIAHEMEN, MOVING SHORTLY, PICTURE)
FASHION
MILAN - The fashion shows spotlight moves gently to Milan with dreamy designs reminding the raincoated audience of romantic evenings on a hot beachfront.
(LIFE-FASHION-MILAN, BY JANE BARRETT, EXPECT BY 1500, PICTURE)
LONDON NEWSDESK: +44 20-7542-7925
WASHINGTON NEWSDESK: +1 202-898-8465
ASIA DESK SINGAPORE: +65 6870-3815
